animatedSpriteEditor

Class AnimatedSpriteEditor

  • java.lang.Object
    • animatedSpriteEditor.AnimatedSpriteEditor

  • public class AnimatedSpriteEditor
extends java.lang.Object
    The AnimatedSpriteEditor application is a pose editor, allowing the user to construct sprite types, animations of sprites types, and images to be used for making sprites. The application will save its internal representation of a pose in an xml file and can export that representation to a .png format as an image. This class employs the Singleton Design Pattern, which makes it the focal point, providing a means of data exchange between the other classes.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    sixin

    • Method Detail

      • init

        public void init()
        When called, this init method will fully initialize the application, including loading the application settings from an xml file and using that to setup the window. Notice that the constructor is a singleton object, so we make the constructor private to prevent misuse. This method has the obligation of initialization of the app.

      • getPoseur

        public static AnimatedSpriteEditor getPoseur()
        This is an important method to understand. This method initialize the singleton object, making sure it is only done the first time this method is called. From there on out, anyone can access this Poseur by calling this method.
        Returns:
        The singleton Poseur used for this application.

      • getGUI

        public animatedSpriteEditor.gui.AnimatedSpriteEditorGUI getGUI()
        Accessor method for getting the application's GUI. Note that since this is a singleton, anyone can get access to the GUI.
        Returns:
        The PoseurFrame for this application, which is the window for this application and contains references to all components and event handlers in use.

      • getStateManager

        public animatedSpriteEditor.state.EditorStateManager getStateManager()
        Accessor method for getting this application's state manager. Note that since this is a singleton, anyone can get access to the state.
        Returns:
        The PoseurDataManager for this application, which contains all the data for the pose being edited.

      • getFileManager

        public animatedSpriteEditor.files.EditorFileManager getFileManager()
        Accessor method for getting this application's file manager. Note that since this is a singleton, anyone can get access to this object.

      • getDebugTextIterator

        public java.util.Iterator<java.lang.String> getDebugTextIterator()
        This accessor method gets an iterator for going through all the current debug text sequentially.
        Returns:
        An iterator for the debug text list.

      • isDebugTextEnabled

        public boolean isDebugTextEnabled()
        Accessor method for testing if the debug text is enabled. If true, the text will be rendered to the canvas, if false, it will not.
        Returns:
        true if the debug text rendering is enabled, false otherwise.

      • addDebugText

        public void addDebugText(java.lang.String text)
        Adds the text argument to the debugText list, which means that it will be rendered to the screen. This is good for getting feedback in a graphical application.
        Parameters:
        text - The text to be rendered.

      • clearDebugText

        public void clearDebugText()
        This method removes all debug text, and will typically be done after each time we clear the canvases.

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        Entry point for the Poseur application, code starts its execution here. This method simply inits the Poseur singleton and starts up the GUI.
        Parameters:
        args - Command line arguments are not used by this application.
